topic.title: Using C++ Source Code
topic.p: Here are dependencies of the source code. Each box means a pair of .h and .cpp file. For example, Vlpp means Vlpp.h and Vlpp.cpp.
Source code can be found in the Import folder.

topic.title: Vlpp, VlppOS, VlppRegex, VlppReflection, VlppParser
topic.p: These files are basic C++ constructions. GacUI is built on these libraries. In most of the cases, you only need functions and classes from Vlpp and VlppOs.

topic.title: VlppWorkflowLibrary
topic.p: This file contains a very thin library for generated C++ code from the Workflow script language. UI elements of GacUI are recommended to create from XML. All resource files will be compiled to the Workflow script language first, and then scripts are generate C++ code from these scripts. You need this file to run your UI.

topic.title: VlppWorkflowRuntime and VlppWorkflowCompiler

p.b: Usually you don't need these files.

topic.p: VlppWorkflowRuntime contains virtual machine to run the Workflow script language directly. The runtime can serialize compiled script to a binary file and reload it. If some reflectable C++ classes are used in the script, please make sure all these classes are registered when loading it. VlppWorkflowCompiler contains a compiler for the Workflow script language.

topic.title: GacUI, GacUIWindows and DarkSkin
topic.p: This is the GacUI itself. GacUIWindows is the port to Windows OS. All Windows older than 7 are not supported. DarkSkin is the default skin. If you have created your own skin for every controls, you don't need this file.

topic.title: GacUIReflection and DarkSkinReflection

p.b: Usually you don't need these files.

topic.p:
These files register all reflectable classes for GacUI. You only need this when you need to dynamically compiler and execute Workflow scripts that access GacUI classes.
When you don't need reflection
Don't link these files.
You must add VCZH_DEBUG_NO_REFLECTION using preprocessor definitions. You can either to this by updating your project properties, or use the /D compiler option if you are using Visual Studio Code.
You will save about 20 megabytes in the executable file
When you need reflection
Link these files.
You must not add VCZH_DEBUG_NO_REFLECTION

topic.title: GacUICompiler

p.b: Usually you don't need these files.

topic.p: This is the GacUI XML resource compiler. GacGen32.exe and GacGen64.exe are the executable version of this file.

topic.title: Using Build Tools
topic.p: Tools can be found in the Tools folder.
You only need GacBuild.ps1 and GacClear.ps1. They required Powershell. If crashes happen in the script instead of in executable files, you may want to upgrade your Powershell version and try again.
Please note that, although you only need to run the above 2 script files, all files in this folder are required.
